overview: From 2025-06-04 to 2025-06-05, elizaos/eliza had 17 new PRs (11 merged), 10 new issues, and 10 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Web client thinks it is on a different version
topIssues.author: scottrepreneur
topIssues.body: **Describe the bug** The web client shows `v1.0.3` but the cli and core are on `v1.0.4` **To Reproduce** 1. `elizaos create` 2. select defaults 3. cd & `elizaos start` 4. open web client 5. see incorrect version and update spaz banner **Expected behavior** Should see matching version in web client ```bash Version: 1.0.4 [2025-06-04 13:38:06] WARN: Server authentication is disabled. Set ELIZA_SERVER_AUTH_TOKEN environment variable to enable. Startup successful! Go to the dashboard at http://localhost:3000 ``` **Screenshots** https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c435654e-56df-4ecd-93f5-3faf2d1db91c **Additional Context** elizaos: `v1.0.4` Mac: `15.5`

topIssues.title: Installation and plugins issue with aws bedrock
topIssues.author: omariosman
topIssues.body:
When I create an eliza project using `elizaos create` I cannot find aws bedrock as a model provider
However, when I clone the whole `eliza repo`, I can find aws bedrock model, why does that happen?
How can I get to access aws bedrock model even from `elizaos create` without the need to clone the whole repo

topIssues.title: Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING with OpenAI
topIssues.author: Kirstygoodary
topIssues.body:
Having issues in the chat, when writing the message getting this error: 

```
file:///Users/../.nvm/versions/node/v23.3.0/lib/node_modules/@elizaos/cli/dist/chunk-GFPVHNVN.js:46822
      throw new Error(`No handler found for delegate type: ${modelKey}`);
            ^
```
```
Error: No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING
```

I've added the open api key to .env. 

On line 45459 in `chunk-GFPVHNVN.js`  - `TEXT_EMBEDDING: "TEXT_EMBEDDING"`,  is being used as the `modelKey` it seems. 
is this right for `modelType`? 

Also tried `rm -rf ~/.eliza` and restarted.

topIssues.title: Agent won't respond to twitter mentions
topIssues.author: CurralesDragon
topIssues.body:
```
   agentName: "Eliza"
[2025-06-04 13:31:03.404 +0200] DEBUG: Service instrumentation not found
    agentName: "Eliza"
[2025-06-04 11:31:04] DEBUG: [Bootstrap] Response evaluation for Eliza:
<response>
  <name>Eliza</name>
  <reasoning>... is directly asking for clarification, so it's appropriate to respond.</reasoning>
  <action>REPLY</action>
</response>
{"level":20,"time":1749036664690,"pid":3826,"hostname":"MacBook-Pro-9.local","msg":"Found response XML block"}
shouldRespond is false
shouldSkipShouldRespond false
[2025-06-04 11:31:04] DEBUG: [Bootstrap] Response type: string
[2025-06-04 11:31:04] DEBUG (Eliza): [Bootstrap] Parsed response:
    reasoning: "... is directly asking for clarification, so it's appropriate to respond."
    action: "REPLY"
[2025-06-04 11:31:04] DEBUG: [Bootstrap] Agent decided not to respond (shouldRespond is false).
[2025-06-04 11:31:04] WARN: No text content in response, skipping tweet reply
```
Agent won't respond to any mentions when creating a project via the CLI

Running default agent with env variables set, all the functionality from the twitter interactions seems to work except for the replies. The action taken is actually IGNORE instead of REPLY 

Default config and settings Version: 1.0.4

Am i missing something?

topPRs.title: 1.0.5 develop merge
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
This pull request introduces several changes across multiple files, focusing on improving plugin development workflows, refining message handling logic, and simplifying client-side configurations. Key updates include the introduction of a new utility for detecting local plugin development contexts, enhancements to the message bus service for better handling of direct messages, and the removal of redundant scripts in the client package.

### Plugin Development Enhancements:
* Added `plugin-context` utilities to detect local plugin development scenarios, ensure plugins are built before loading, and provide guidance when issues occur. These changes impact files like `packages/cli/src/utils/plugin-context.ts`, `install-plugin.ts`, and `load-plugin.ts`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-82c66107ee0ef273a03277a2536340f5ff1061780808d49e160ff641b80d1cd8R1-R142) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-74a3576479d0da74bc7663b3f9e5af4ff702625b15832eae51be54ab9b21bcf8R8) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-0cf79118603e21c1796db0c0a2d3f9946318d2ec59cb14eef71115ff5368f603L77-R109)
* Updated `loadAndPreparePlugin` in `start.ts` to prioritize local development scenarios when loading plugins. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6858dc88bcb8c8d88063b185a5bddbe2709171731c56c401cbf793bf7ff5baa1R51-R71) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6858dc88bcb8c8d88063b185a5bddbe2709171731c56c401cbf793bf7ff5baa1R98)
* Prevented self-installation of plugins in `installPlugin` to avoid accidental overwrites during development.

### Message Handling Improvements:
* Enhanced `MessageBusService` to validate UUIDs, handle direct message channels, and log detailed information for debugging purposes. This includes checks for agent participation in DM channels and fallback behavior when participant checks fail.
* Added `validateUuid` import to `message.ts` for improved validation logic.

### Client-Side Simplifications:
* Removed the `version.sh` script and related references from `packages/client/package.json`, simplifying the build process. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef328a58a2bf7849f068b414807c673ff1d348e37d0df64299eeab7acb793fdL1-L28) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-26d3d28d31824ef26252df77cca08d24faea8451cb8fd3ffee2000f9e496daa0L8-L27)
* Updated `package.json` in the client package to streamline scripts and dependencies, such as replacing `vitest` test commands with coverage support and removing unnecessary dependencies. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-26d3d28d31824ef26252df77cca08d24faea8451cb8fd3ffee2000f9e496daa0R72) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-26d3d28d31824ef26252df77cca08d24faea8451cb8fd3ffee2000f9e496daa0R82) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-26d3d28d31824ef26252df77cca08d24faea8451cb8fd3ffee2000f9e496daa0L98)
* Added `fs` import to `vite.config.ts` for potential future use.

### Other Notable Changes:
* Modified the `copy-templates` script to exclude `node_modules` and `.git` directories during template copying.
* Updated the Tauri app's `run` function to directly call `elizaos` instead of using `npx`.

topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli

topPRs.title: fix: prevent circular dependency
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
# Fix Circular Dependency During Plugin Testing

## üö® Problem

When plugin developers run `elizaos test` from within their plugin directory, the CLI encounters a critical circular dependency issue:

1. **Test Command Execution**: `elizaos test` is run from within a plugin directory (e.g., `/path/to/my-plugin/`)
2. **Plugin Loading Attempt**: The CLI attempts to load the plugin being tested
3. **Loading Failure**: Plugin not found in node_modules (since it's being developed locally)
4. **Installation Trigger**: System calls `installPlugin()` to install the missing plugin
5. **Self-Installation**: Plugin tries to install itself into its own directory
6. **Circular Dependency**: üí• Creates circular reference, corrupts package.json, and breaks testing

### Real-World Impact
- Plugin developers cannot run tests without encountering errors
- Package.json files get corrupted by self-installation attempts
- Development workflow is severely hindered
- Poor developer experience discourages plugin development

## üîç Root Cause Analysis

The core issue lies in the plugin loading system's lack of **context awareness**:

### Current Flow (Problematic)
```
elizaos test (in plugin dir) 
  ‚Üí startAgent() 
  ‚Üí loadAndPreparePlugin("@user/plugin-name")
  ‚Üí loadPluginModule() [FAILS - not in node_modules]
  ‚Üí installPlugin("@user/plugin-name", process.cwd()) [CIRCULAR\!]
  ‚Üí Package corruption & dependency errors
```

### Key Issues Identified
1. **No Local Development Detection**: System doesn't recognize when operating within a plugin's own directory
2. **Blind Installation Logic**: `installPlugin()` doesn't prevent self-installation
3. **Missing Context**: No distinction between "external plugin" vs "current plugin being tested"
4. **Poor Error Handling**: Generic error messages provide no actionable guidance

## ‚úÖ Solution: Context-Aware Plugin Resolution

This PR introduces a comprehensive **context-aware plugin resolution system** that intelligently handles local plugin development scenarios.

### New Architecture

```
elizaos test (in plugin dir)
  ‚Üí detectPluginContext() [NEW: Smart detection]
  ‚Üí IF local development detected:
    ‚Üí Load from local dist/ [PREVENTS circular dependency]
    ‚Üí Auto-build if needed
    ‚Üí Provide helpful guidance
  ‚Üí ELSE:
    ‚Üí Continue with normal plugin installation flow
```

## üõ† Implementation Details

### 1. Plugin Context Detection System

**New File**: `src/utils/plugin-context.ts`

```typescript
export function detectPluginContext(pluginName: string): PluginContext {
  // Intelligent detection of local plugin development
  // Handles various naming conventions and directory structures
  // Returns context with build status and local paths
}
```

**Features**:
- **Smart Name Matching**: Handles `@scope/plugin-name`, `plugin-name`, `name` variations
- **Directory Fallback**: Matches by directory name when package names differ
- **Build Detection**: Checks if plugin is built and ready to load
- **Path Resolution**: Provides exact paths for local loading

### 2. Enhanced Plugin Loading Strategy

**Modified**: `src/utils/load-plugin.ts`

**New Priority Order**:
1. **üéØ Local Development Plugin** (NEW - Highest Priority)
2. Workspace dependency
3. Direct path
4. Local node_modules
5. Global node_modules
6. Package.json entry
7. Common dist pattern

**Local Development Strategy**:
- Detects plugin development context
- Auto-builds plugin if needed
- Loads directly from `dist/` output
- Provides helpful error messages
- Skips unnecessary installation attempts

### 3. Self-Installation Prevention

**Modified**: `src/utils/install-plugin.ts` & `src/commands/start.ts`

```typescript
// NEW: Early detection prevents circular dependency
const context = detectPluginContext(pluginName);
if (context.isLocalDevelopment) {
  // Block self-installation
  // Provide helpful guidance
  // Load locally instead
}
```

**Benefits**:
- **Prevents Corruption**: No more package.json modification attempts
- **Clear Messaging**: Explains why installation was prevented
- **Alternative Path**: Suggests local build and provides commands

### 4. Improved Developer Experience

**Enhanced Error Handling**:
- Context-aware error messages
- Specific build instructions
- Actionable guidance for developers
- Clear explanation of detection logic

topPRs.title: windows compatibility
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body: This PR enables vanilla windows to build by fixing some dependencies on bash and symlinking

completedItems.title: fix: agent self-response infinite loop in message service
completedItems.body:
## Summary
Fixed infinite loop where multiple agents were responding to each other's messages, creating endless back-and-forth conversations.

## Root Cause
The issue was that agents were processing and responding to any agent_response mess

completedItems.title: feat: chat ui improvements
completedItems.body:
## Summary
- Fix thought and action data persistence after page refresh by extracting from rawMessage in messages API
- Fix user message alignment to appear on right side of chat consistently across DM and GROUP modes  
- Fix inactive agent

completedItems.title: chore: update bun.lockb
completedItems.body:
This PR updates the bun.lockb file to ensure it's in sync with the latest dependencies.

After running `bun install`, no changes were detected in the lockfile, indicating that all dependencies are already up to date.
